properties.headline: Sydney Royal Easter Show - Thursday 1 to Monday 12 April - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Epping Rd, Lane Cove Rd
properties.publicTransport: Express trains and Major Event Buses are running daily - tap on & off using an Opal card or contactless payment as travel is not included in tickets to the Show. Buses in the precinct are diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to visit the annual Sydney Royal Easter Show at Sydney Olympic Park each day from Thursday 1 April until Monday 12 April. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd approaching the precinct throughout the show.

PARKING UPDATE: all available parking spaces at Olympic Park for the final day of the Show on Monday 12 April have been pre-booked. Follow signs and direction of staff to your allocated parking space. If you haven't pre-booked a space consider other parking options, public transport or taxi and rideshare.

Roads in the precinct are closed for the duration of the Show until 6am Tuesday 13 April including sections of Dawn Fraser Ave, Olympic Blvd, Showground Rd, Murray Rose Ave, Kevin Coombs Ave, Marjorie Jackson Pwy, Shirley Strickland Ave, Rod Laver Dr and Shane Gould Ave. Other roads in the precinct will remain closed until 20 April to allow for the removal of event infrastructure.

arrangementElements.html:
Roads within the Sydney Olympic Park precinct will be closed prior to the Show to allow for even infrastructure set up. Additional roads will close during the Show for crow safety and will remain closed until after the Show for event pack down.

FROM 1AM TUESDAY 16 MARCH TO APPROX. 10AM TUESDAY 20 APRIL 2021

  • Olympic Boulevard 100m north of Dawn Fraser Avenue adjacent to the Cathy Freeman Park amenities to 200m south of Edwin Flack Ave outside Qudos Bank Arena

FROM 12:01AM THURSDAY 18 MARCH TO 10AM TUESDAY 20 APRIL 2021

  • Australia Avenue from Murray Rose Avenue to Kevin Coombs Avenue
  • Showground Road from Murray Rose Avenue to Grand Parade
  • Grand Parade from Olympic Boulevard to Australia Avenue

FROM 2AM THURSDAY 1 APRIL TO 6AM TUESDAY 13 APRIL 2021

  • Kevin Coombs Avenue from Australia Avenue to Pondage Link
  • Marjorie Jackson Parkway from Wentworth Common Carpark to Australia Ave
  • Olympic Boulevard from Kevin Coombs to Sarah Durack Avenue
  • Showground Road from Murray Rose Avenue to Dawn Fraser Avenue
  • Murray Rose Avenue from Showground Road to Gate 15 (fixed closure) & Park Street
  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Edwin Flack Avenue to Showground Road (Accessible drop off / pick up & Show drop off / pick up – Edwin Flack Avenue to Fig Grove)
  • Shirley Strickland Ave from Rod Laver Drive to Olympic Boulevard
  • Shirley Strickland Ave from Olympic Boulevard to the M4 Exit (P4 car park)
  • Rod Laver Drive from Shirley Strickland to the Tennis Centre
  • Shane Gould Avenue at P2 Car Park

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Family Show is taking place at The Entertainment Quarter from Thursday 1 to Sunday 18 April from 10am to 5pm each day.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as families travel to and from The Sydney Family Show each day. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian movement.

properties.headline: Anzac Day Service and March - Sunday 18 April - MASCOT Botany Road between King Street AND Coward Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses may experience delays through Mascot while closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info for service disruption information.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Anzac Day Mascot 2021 - closure and clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Anzac Day Mascot 2021 - closure and clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
Anzac Day commemorations will be held at Mascot on Sunday 18 April. The march will start from King St at 2:15pm, finishing at Mascot Memorial Park by 2:45pm.

The northbound lanes of Botany Rd will be closed from King St to Coward St from 2:15pm until approximately 2:45pm while the march is underway. Sections of Coward St, King St, Forster St, MacIntosh St will also be closed at Botany Rd during this time. 

Special event clearways will be in effect from 12:30pm to 4pm on the western side of Botany Rd from King St to Coward St and on sections of Coward St and King St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents, businesses or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

MASCOT

FROM 2:15PM TO 2:45PM APPROXIMATELY

  • Botany Road between King Street and Coward Street (northbound lanes)
  • Coward Street Between Henry Kendall Crescent (Eastern Side) and Botany Road
  • King Street Library Carpark (230 King Street) and Botany Road
  • Forster Street at Botany Road
  • MacIntosh Street at Botany Road

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location. 

MASCOT 

FROM 12:30PM TO 4PM

  • Botany Road between King Street and Coward Street (western side)
  • Coward Street between Botany Road and Henry Kendall Crescent (both sides)
  • King Street between Botany Road and 230 King Street (both sides)

properties.headline: Anzac Day Dawn Service - Sunday 25 April - BRIGHTON-LE-SANDS Bay Street between The Grand Parade AND Moate Avenue
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
An Anzac Day Dawn Service will be held outside the Brighton Le Sands RSL Club on Sunday 25 April from 6am to 6:50am.

Bay St will be closed in both directions between The Grand Parade and Moate Ave from 5:15am to 7am for the service.

Motorists should follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site and can detour around the closure via local roads.

properties.headline: Anzac Day Dawn Service & March - Sunday 25 April - SYDNEY CBD Martin Place, Elizabeth Street, Liverpool Street
properties.publicTransport: Additional early morning services will run. Travel on public transport is free for veterans and their families. Buses in the city will be diverting while roads are closed. Light rail services will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall during the Dawn Service. Visit transportnsw.info for details.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Anzac Day 2021 road closure and transport map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Anzac Day 2021 road closure and transport map

properties.otherAdvice:
Major city roads will be closed for the Anzac Day Dawn Service in Martin Place and March down Elizabeth St in the Sydney CBD.

KEY ROAD CLOSURES

  • From 2am to 4pm: roads around Martin Place including George and Pitt streets between Hunter and King streets.
  • From 6am to 4pm: key roads along and surrounding the march route between Bridge St and Goulburn St including sections of Castlereagh, Elizabeth, King, Market, Hunter, Bent, Park, Bathurst, Phillip and Liverpool Streets.

Pedestrian crossing of the March route will be maintained on Hunter St at Elizabeth St and along the march route on Elizabeth St at Park St, Bathurst St and Liverpool St. The pop up cycleway on Pitt St will also be closed from 2am to 6am between Hunter and King St, and from 6am to 4pm between Bridge and King St.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on various roads in the Sydney CBD from 1am to 4pm on sections of Clarence St and Pitt St and from 5:30am to 4pm on major roads between Bridge St and Goulburn St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents, businesses or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies so check signs carefully on the day and the night before as clearways come into effect in the early morning.

arrangementElements.html:
Road closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise.

properties.headline: Randwick Races - Saturday 17 April - RANDWICK Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street approaching Royal Randwick Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Championships Day 2 - Autumn Carnival at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 11.15am, last race 4.55pm.

Traffic may be heavier on roads around the racecourse including Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races. Motorists should allow extra travel time while travelling in and around Randwick. 

Special event clearways will be in effect on sections of Ascot St, High St and Darley Rd between 4am and 7pm. Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

  • From 4am to 7pm: Darley Rd between Alison Rd and Centennial Park roundabout (western side)
  • From 8am to 7pm: Ascot St between Doncaster Ave and the roundabout at the racecourse (both sides)
  • From 3pm to 7pm: High St between the entry to the racecourse and Anzac Pde (southern side)

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Dragons at the SCG from 4:05pm to approx 6pm

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on roads around the Moore Park precinct as footy fans travel to the annual Anzac Day game. Motorists should allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. 

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 1pm and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 1pm to 7pm on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists should follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site and can detour around the closure via local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Yours and Owls festival is taking place at Thomas Dalton Park, Fairy Meadow on Saturday 17 and Sunday 18 April. The festival starts at midday each day. 

Carters Ln will be closed from Elliotts Rd to Dixon St each day and Pioneer Rd will be a one-way street northbound to Edgar St during the festival.

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and follow the direct of traffic controllers onsite. Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian movemnet over the weekend.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as fans travel to and from the game.

Mary St will be partially closed at the oval from 2:30pm to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place. Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Coffs Harbour Show - Friday 30 April to Sunday 2 May - COFFS HARBOUR Pacific Highway between Marcia Street AND Beryl Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The Coffs Harbour show is taking place from Friday 30 April to Sunday 2 May at Coffs Harbour Showground. 

The turning lanes of the Pacific Hwy will be closed in both directions between Marcia St and Beryl St from 7am to 11pm each day.

Motorists should take care while travelling in the area and allow extra travel time.
properties.displayName: Coffs Harbour Show - Friday 30 April to Sunday 2 May

roads.mainStreet: Pacific Highway

webLinks.linkText: A-League: Newcastle Jets v Perth Glory

properties.headline: A-League - Tuesday 13 April - COFFS HARBOUR Stadium Drive at Coffs Harbour International Stadium
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Newcastle Jets v Perth Glory at Coffs International Stadium from 7:05pm until approx 9pm. 

Traffic is expected to be heavier than normal on Phil Hawthorne Dr, Stadium Dr, Cunninghams Dr, Hogbin Dr and the Pacific Hwy approaching the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the venue.

roads.mainStreet: Stadium Drive

properties.headline: NewRun - Sunday 11 April - NEWCASTLE Wharf Rd, Shortland Esplanade & Memorial Drive to Bar Beach
properties.publicTransport: Route 21 buses will be affected. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Runners will participate in a marathon, half marathon, 5km or 2km events in the annual NewRun - Newcastle Running Festival starting from 6am at Queens Wharf travelling around the foreshore to finish back at Market St Lawn. The Hill to Harbour 10km run will start from Bar Beach at 8.30am also finishing at Market St Lawn.

Road Closures will be in place between 5am and 11:30am on sections of roads around the event course. 

  • 5am to 11.30am - Wharf Rd from Watt St to Argyle St
  • 5.30am to 11.30am - Wharf Rd from Watt St to Nobbys Rd
  • 5am to 11.30am - Shortland Espl from Zaara St to Nobbys Rd
  • 5.30am to 9.15am - Memorial Dr from Bar Beach Ave to Kilgour Ave

Traffic is expected to be heavy between 5am and 10am as participants arrive and between 1pm and 3pm as they leave the area. 

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time while in the area and to follow the direction of traffic controllers.

roads.mainStreet: Wharf Rd, Shortland Esplanade & Memorial Drive

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 11 April - WOLLONGONG Harbour Street and Burelli Street at WIN Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Wellington Phoenix v Western United from 7:05pm until 9pm approx at WIN Stadium.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Road closures will be in place on sections of Harbour St between Stewart St and Crown St and Burelli St between Corrimal St and Harbour St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking.

roads.mainStreet: Harbour Street and Burelli Street

properties.headline: Triathlon Festival - Sunday 11 April - WOLLONGONG George Hanley Dr,  Squires Way, Corrimal St & Cliff Rd
properties.otherAdvice:
TriTheGong Triathlon Festival is taking place at Lang Park, Wollongong from 6:30am to 1pm. Most events will be contained within the park apart from the cycling component which will heading out of the park to Towradgi Rd via Cliff Rd, Squires Way and Pioneer Rd.

Road closures will be in place from 6am to 1pm to support the event on:

- Cliff Rd from Marine Dr to George Hanley Dr

- Virginia St from Bourke St to George Hanley Dr

- George Hanley Dr from Cliff Rd to Squires Way

- Bessel Ave from Bourke St to Bode St

- Squires Way from George Hanley Dr to Pioneer Rd

- Pioneer Rd from Squires Way to Towradgi Rd

Sections of Bourke St, Kembla St and Virginia St will also be closed. Traffic lights at various intersections on Squires Way and Pioneer Rd will be flashing amber from 6am to 1pm.

Detours will be in place via Towradgi Rd, Elliotts Rd, Bourke St and Corrimal St.

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time, follow detour signs and be aware of cyclists on roads around Wollongong.

roads.mainStreet: George Hanley Dr,  Squires Way, Corrimal St & Cliff Rd

properties.headline: NRL - Sunday 11 April - LEICHHARDT Mary Street at Glover Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Cowboys from 4:05pm until 6pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Mary St will be partially closed at the oval from 2:30pm to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place. Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Mary Street

properties.headline: W-League - Sunday 11 April - KOGARAH Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street at Princes Highway
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
W-League Grand Final: Sydney FC v Melbourne Victory from 4pm until approx 5:45pm at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close before the game including Jubilee Ave, Park St and English St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.headline: NRL - Sunday 11 April - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bankwest Stadium road closure and detour map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bankwest Stadium road closure and detour map

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Dragons at Bankwest Stadium from 6:15pm until 8pm approx.

Traffic will be heavy on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as thousands of fans travel to and from the stadium. 

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time. Fans driving to the game should arrive early as parking will be in high demand. 

Roads outside the stadium will close prior to full-time from around 7.30pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Expect delays and follow directions of traffic control and Police on site while closures are in place.

roads.mainStreet: O'Connell Street

properties.headline: NRL - Saturday 10 April - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park transport and walking map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map Mar21SCO_1080.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park transport and walking map

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Sharks at the SCG from 7:35pm to approx 9:30pm

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on roads around the Moore Park precinct as footy fans travel to the game. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. 

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5:30pm and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK

FROM 3PM TO 11PM - SATURDAY 10 APRIL

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Devonshire Street (both sides)
  • Cleveland Street between City Road and South Dowling Street
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.headline: NBL - Sunday 11 April - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching Stadium Australia
properties.publicTransport: Express trains and Major Event Buses will run - use your Opal card. Buses in the precinct will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Sydney Kings v South East Melbourne Phoenix at Qudos Bank Arena, tip off from 2.45pm finish around 5.10pm

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd approaching the precinct as traffic will be heavy with Easter Show crowds also travelling to the precinct.

PARKING UPDATE: all available parking spaces at Olympic Park for Sunday 11 April are sold out, if you haven't pre-booked a space consider other parking options, public transport or taxi and rideshare.

Roads in the precinct are closed until 6am Tuesday 13 April including sections of Dawn Fraser Ave, Olympic Blvd, Showground Rd, Murray Rose Ave, Kevin Coombs Ave, Marjorie Jackson Pwy, Shirley Strickland Ave, Rod Laver Dr and Shane Gould Ave.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road
